alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LEWIS, NORTHEASTERN ADAMS, PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 504 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Rome, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, Waverly, New Boston, Piketon, Peebles, Marshall, South Webster, Rosemount, Clarktown, Lucasville, Highland Holiday, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Rocky Fork Point, Sciotodale, Cynthiana, Franklin Furnace, Blue Creek and Beaver. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
